posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content: I'd look into going FTR 10/Rogue 4 for more tumble dumps (called shot is not fundamental and could be the feat that gets dropped). I'd also get myself a weapon with a wider crit range because of dev crit, or at least one that can be keened. That said, it's a pretty solid build. I think I had something similar going for Dev Crit: Greatsword and EDR III a while ago on a now dead PW.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
KailPendragon wrote:I'd look into going FTR 10/Rogue 4 for more tumble dumps (called shot is not fundamental and could be the feat that gets dropped). I'd also get myself a weapon with a wider crit range because of dev crit, or at least one that can be keened. That said, it's a pretty solid build. I think I had something similar going for Dev Crit: Greatsword and EDR III a while ago on a now dead PW.
About Fighter 10 Rogue 4 it could be an option, but I would have to take all 4 Rogue levels after 20 beacuse I can't afford to lose the BAB, which is bad enough as it is, so playability-wise it's not a bad tweak, but also not vital either. I was originally making him with a Dwarven Waraxe, so Called Shot was actually Weapon Proficiency Exotic, which wasn't droppable back then. But then playing on WoG, Dwarven Waraxes there are shyt, so I decided to change. That modification is purely server-oriented, because of Arbas' Sunderer and Scar the Inquisitor's Hammer of Thunderbolts, which ROCKS! I should probably post a more general version of it with the dwarven waraxe as originally intended and take off my WoG glasses for a bit

Greatsword wouldn't be bad either. King Snurre's Chaos Fire comes to mind ^^

Thanks for the suggestions.

Take it EZ!

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content: Enhanced playability from lvl 1(2) to lvl 20 is worth -1 AB, especially on WoG. Think UMD right from the start and possibly some trap skills. And remember you can buy custom weapons from the DM on WoG. Just a thought.

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
I gotta get the hang of using traps, never really got into it. Will do it with my Bane Crusher build, which I will repost here sometime soon. But it's a non-self-buffer with 42 AB, which is kinda bad. It'll end up with an effective AB of 53 with Capped STR and +5 GMW without dropping 1 BAB as you suggested, which would make it the lowest AB build I have ever concocted . Well, not really, but the lowest AB melee-oriented build I have ever come up with. I know the purpose is to just soak damage, but I would like to see ways of enhancing that abysmal score without dropping CON and EDR, not drop it any further. I don't really suffer with playability all that much. Moathouse, TOEE, Hill Giant Steading, Dragon Cult, and then Critwall from 18 on and Fire Giants and WDK after 35 is sort of my "route" in WoG, with the occasional Duergar Caves, Cyclops and Hugo once. I find I can solo it just fine with just about any toon I have played. Do you think I can get my hands on Divine Favor wands with 15 caster levels?? That would really be handy: 58 AB ain't that bad. Would be my second lowest AB build then

Take it EZ!

posts.author: KailPendragon
posts.content: 42 mundane AB for a meleer with a defensive attitude is ok. If it were not so we would be playing only FTR/Rogue/WMs (heavy on WM) and FTR/Bard/RDDs as non buffing melee builds.
